coref: A Serpent had succeeded in surprising an Eagle and had wrapped A Serpent around an Eagle's neck. an Eagle Eagle could not reach A Serpent, neither with beak nor claws. Far into the sky A Serpent soared trying to shake off A Serpent enemy. But A Serpent's hold only tightened, and an Eagle Eagle sank back to earth, gasping for breath. A Countryman chanced to see the unequal combat. In pity for an Eagle Eagle A Serpent rushed up and soon had loosened A Serpent and freed an Eagle. A Serpent was furious. A Serpent had no chance to bite A CountrymanA Countryman. Instead A Serpent struck at the drinking horn, hanging at A Countryman's belt, and into the Countryman's belt let fly the poison of A Serpent fangs. A Countryman Countryman now went on toward home. Becoming thirsty on the way, A Countryman filled the drinking horn at a spring, and was about to drink. There was a sudden rush of great wings. Sweeping down, an Eagle an Eagle seized the drinking horn from out A Countryman savior's hands, and flew away with an Eagle to hide an Eagle where an Eagle could never be found.
